ARTICLE.TITLE: Caravan calling for justice in Ahmaud Arbery case rallies in Georgia
ARTICLE.TEXT:
A justice caravan: That’s what a local group says is taking off this morning from Atlanta to Brunswick to protest the handling of the Ahmaud Arbery case.

The caravan, led by the group Just Georgia left from Victory Outreach Church in southwest Atlanta Saturday morning.

They are now rallied at the Glynn County Courthouse. Some speakers are demanding the resignation of two district attorneys who were originally assigned the case.

Stay with Channel 2 Action News for LIVE updates on this story

A large group preparing RIGHT NOW to caravan from Atlanta to Brunswick, calling for the resignation of the two original District Attorneys in the #AhmaudArbery case.@wsbtv pic.twitter.com/HgSYQaLFdp — Audrey Washington (@AudreyWSBTV) May 16, 2020

Arbery, who was unarmed, was shot and killed by a father and his son in February. It wasn't until last week that the GBI took over the case and arrested them.

The group is calling for the resignation of two district attorneys for what many say was a mishandling of the investigation.

"What we know historically is that in order for black people in America to get justice, we have to organize, we have to protest. It's unfortunate but it's been the reality of our history,” said attorney Mawuli Davis.

We will have LIVE coverage of the rally this afternoon on WSBTV.com and on Channel 2 Action News on WSB Now – it’s free on your Roku, Amazon Fire or Apple TV as well as your WSB-TV News App.
